Mark Watney.Action: Performs EVA experiment carefully, records observations methodically and communicates scientific findings precisely.
Displays optimism and bright-eyed attitude while working on Mars, indicating confidence and positive mindset.
Engages in light banter with Martinez, showing social ease but does not neglect task focus.
Teases Martinez and others by telling Martinez to shut his smart mouth, joining light banter that annoys others.
Throws arms in the background after radios go silent, showing playful frustration and desire to continue interaction.
Engages in lighthearted banter and insists on maintaining constant communication despite being told to shut radios off.
Asks about the Abort Force during mission update, showing awareness of technical limits and potential risks.
Suggests shoring up the MAV to make tipping less likely by using cables and rovers as anchors during the storm.
Proposes a practical plan to shore up the MAV using cables from the solar farm and anchoring with rovers during a dangerous storm.
Gets struck and knocked away by a massive section of antenna during the storm, becoming unreachable.
Yanks a jagged antenna piercing his abdomen out of his spacesuit despite intense pain, then seals the breach and stabilizes his oxygen, staying conscious and alive.
Recognizes the suit breach and immediately uses the breach kit to seal the hole after agonizingly pulling out the antenna, stabilizing his oxygen supply and staying conscious despite severe pain.
Despite injury and pain, he perseveres to climb the hill toward the Hab, showing determination and resilience.
Endures severe pain and fear while performing self-surgery to remove shrapnel and stitch his wound.
Records a video log to document his survival in case he doesn't make it, showing sincerity and openness.
Expresses surprise and communicates honestly about his situation despite extreme adversity.
Reflects on being left alone and the pain he's in without blaming others, showing tolerance and good-natured acceptance.
Sutures his own severe wound despite shaking hands and pain, completing the procedure to keep himself alive.
Struggles to operate the video journal camera, initially unfamiliar with controls but eventually figures it out.
Reflects realistically and calmly on his dire situation without panic, demonstrating mental resilience and presence of mind.
Acknowledges the dire situation honestly and calmly without panic.
Begins careful inventory and analysis of available resources.
Considers an idea after observing the vacuum-drying waste system, indicating creative problem-solving.
Addresses the camera with a humorous, lighthearted attitude despite dire circumstances.
Focuses on solving problems such as stretching food supply and growing food to survive.
Expresses pride in his professional skills (botany) playfully, which shows sincerity but also self-confidence.
Demonstrates persistence by getting up after having not moved much, indicating self-motivation but no direct social warmth.
Makes the decision to get up and start problem-solving despite physical and emotional exhaustion.
Uses basic tools (pencil and paper) to begin calculating his food supply situation clearly and logically.
Accurately assesses his food supplies and plans rationing based on mission data and his own circumstances.
Confidently embraces his role as botanist and plans to grow food on Mars.
Shows frustration but continues actions necessary for survival, indicating persistence.
Meticulously prepares soil and plants potatoes to sustain himself, showing care and patience.
Covers the entire Hab with soil including personal spaces, demonstrating dedication and respect for his environment.
Finds and watches old episodes of seventies television, suggesting a moment of solitude but also a desire for comfort and connection.
Grins with satisfaction as his experiment to create water succeeds, showing enthusiasm and a positive attitude.
Works carefully and methodically with potentially dangerous materials without causing harm.
Devises a method to manufacture water by catalyzing Hydrazine into hydrogen and nitrogen, then burning hydrogen safely inside a makeshift tent with a chimney.
Carefully constructs a safe working environment (duct-taped trash-bag tent with chimney, wears protective EVA suit lining and goggles) before performing a dangerous chemical reaction.
Makes a joke about Martinez' personal items and shaves the cross, reasoning that God won't mind the situation.
Talks to the camera with humor and self-deprecation after blowing himself up.
Attempts to create fire on Mars for an experiment despite the risks by repurposing a wooden cross, showing creativity and resourcefulness.
Does not double-check his atmospheric calculations carefully, leading to an explosion that injures him.
Acknowledges his mistake openly and critically reflects on the error, showing self-awareness and learning potential.
Shares amusing historical anecdote about Jet Propulsion Laboratory founding, showing lightheartedness and approachability.
Focuses on technical survival tasks and personal efforts without direct interaction with others.
Checks his math and adjusts O2 levels carefully before proceeding with a risky operation involving a torch.
Successfully vents hydrazine without causing an explosion, demonstrating skill and caution.
Observes water condensation forming in the Hab and verifies water levels, indicating attention to detail and understanding of his environment.
Reflects on a historical story of early rocket scientists to motivate himself, showing confidence and intellectual engagement.
Sits dazed and a little out of it for a while after an incident.
Systematically vents hydrazine, monitors readouts, collects and spreads water over soil, maintains a strict routine of work, eating, and sleeping to sustain life-supporting experiments.
Successfully cultivates a plant (a green sprout) in a hostile Martian environment after consistent effort and scientific procedures.
Expresses frustration with disco music humorously, indicating a candid and lighthearted attitude despite dire circumstances.
Directly addresses Commander Lewis with a joking complaint, engaging sincerely through humor.
Focuses on long-term survival and problem-solving, showing resilience but limited direct social warmth in this excerpt.
Checks a map of Mars while making calculations, indicating careful planning and problem-solving.
Expresses frustration verbally about disco music but maintains focus on survival tasks.
Speaks directly to the camera, transparently sharing his problems and plans.
Focuses intensely on technical problems and survival without reference to others or social connection.
Speaks to the camera with honesty about his freezing and problem-solving efforts, including hesitation and a self-deprecating moment.
Shares a humorous and lighthearted moment by playing a disco song he found on Commander Lewis' personal drive, despite his dire situation.
Remains stone-faced and emotionally restrained while listening to the disco song, showing limited outward warmth.
Scours every single data file available on Commander Lewis’ personal drive to find music to play during his rover trip.
Uses incremental rover trips as tests for a longer, more dangerous journey to the Ares 4 launch site to reestablish communication.
Chooses to keep a positive attitude and maintains focus even while facing life-threatening risks, shown by his humor and stone-faced acceptance.
Transforms the Hab into a makeshift greenhouse and successfully cultivates a large potato crop from limited resources, showing agricultural ingenuity and problem-solving.
Realizes that despite his success with the potatoes, the crucial problem of making contact with NASA remains unsolved, indicating prioritization and realistic assessment of challenges.
Studies maps carefully, puzzles over a problem, then has a breakthrough and decides on a plan of action.
Initiates movement with Rover 2 to execute his plan, showing decisiveness and application of knowledge.
Uses the Technician's notebook effectively, studies it carefully, and figures out his destination confidently.
Successfully locates buried metal part by digging, showing problem-solving and resourcefulness skills.
Successfully uncovers Pathfinder and retrofits the lander's battery with an environment heater, demonstrating methodical and skilled technical work.
Begins to dance upon successfully establishing communication with Earth.
Successfully acquires a signal by angling the high gain antenna towards Earth, enabling communication after a period of silence.
Uses creative written notes posted in view of the camera to facilitate simple yes/no communication despite technical limitations.
Creates an elaborate communication system using cards and ASCII table to connect with mission control despite severe limitations.
Makes lighthearted, friendly jokes about Johanssen's laptop content, showing a sense of humor and human connection.
Responds to NASA's messages with patience and engages collaboratively in communication setup.
Makes a self-deprecating joke: 'Glad to hear it. Really looking forward to not dying.'
Hacks the rover's operating system to communicate with Pathfinder by inputting complex code as per NASA instructions.
Waits patiently at the computer after inputting the code, showing confidence and composure.
Reacts with frustration and uses strong language upon learning crew doesn't know he's alive.
Expresses frustration and swears candidly despite high stress, showing emotional honesty and communication under pressure.
Survives alone on Mars for two months, maintaining health and communicating with NASA despite extreme isolation and danger.
Jokes playfully and shows lightheartedness in his video logs.
Focuses on his tasks like watering plants without showing visible frustration or complaint.
Boasts about being the best botanist on the planet.
Poses for a lighthearted photo with a thumbs-up and a friendly note for NASA.
Successfully grows crops expected to last longer than mission duration, impressing the Botany Team.
Displays confident and assertive communication style, telling the Botany Team off when questioned.
Steps into the airlock which then catastrophically fails causing major damage and breach.
Remains calm and resourceful after a life-threatening accident, methodically searching for the air leak and using his tools to solve the problem despite panic and injury.
Grins after successfully detecting and sealing a leak with duct tape.
Works fast and resourcefully to patch his EVA suit despite difficult conditions.
Uses ingenuity and perseverance to roll the airlock closer to the Hab.
Stares at ruined crops and devastated Hab for a long time, then begins to clean up the mess.
After discovering his crops ruined, he takes a long moment to absorb the situation but then begins cleaning up the mess and planning next steps.
Responds to Martinez's email with a calm and witty reply, indicating control over his situation despite isolation on Mars.
Starts a friendly, joking message to Martinez mentioning the disco music surviving despite the Hab explosion.
Responds with casual friendliness and maintains communication with crew on Hermes.
Accidentally blew up the Hab but manages to patch the hole with canvas and duct tape, successfully repressurizing it.
Takes inventory and continues working despite dangerous and precarious conditions.
Types a witty, confident response to the message from NASA, showing composure and morale despite dire circumstances.
No negative or incompetent actions or omissions are shown in this excerpt; he is proactive in communication.
Talks to camera honestly about his dire situation and shows frustration openly.
Uses humor and sarcasm (e.g., hating potatoes 'with the fiery passion of a thousand suns') despite hardship.
Requests Commander Lewis to check on his parents and tell them about their time on Mars if he dies.
Sends a message to Pathfinder after a catastrophic event, demonstrating presence of mind and initiative to communicate.
Prepares for the possibility of his death by asking Commander Lewis to check on his parents, showing thoughtful foresight and calm acceptance.
Trudges out to scrub solar panels repeatedly, showing persistence.
Stops scrubbing, seems overwhelmed and sits alone silently despite the alarm blaring, showing vulnerability and self-awareness.
Pauses to examine Vogel's dropped specimen drill and unfinished work, showing respect for teammate's efforts.
Addresses camera while working diligently on experiments despite somber mood; takes responsibility for finishing Commander Lewis' work.
Jokes about touching the ChemCam and makes a playful comment about a cataloguing system ('Das Core Samples' in respect for the Fatherland).
Systematically performs EVAs with a clear pattern and purpose, extending his range carefully.
Sends detailed scientific data transmissions to NASA, continuing mission tasks independently.
Works diligently on chemistry experiments despite not fully understanding the subject.
Keeps a sense of humor (e.g. naming cataloguing system 'Das Core Samples') while working under pressure.
Tries to keep everything documented and organized, acknowledging it's not his strong suit but wants others to benefit from it, humorously naming the syllabus after himself.
Talks directly to the camera, sharing plans and challenges with a candid, friendly tone.
Shows confidence and optimism by grinning and expressing enthusiasm about being rescued.
Acknowledges global support by crediting the 'brainpower of the entire planet Earth' for helping solve problems.
Plans to travel 3,200 kilometers across Mars in 200 sols using ingenuity and support from Earth experts.
Figures out a practical method to fix roof holes in the rover by drilling 700 holes and preparing to hit them with a rock.
Acknowledges the difficulty of the work (grueling drilling) but continues persistently.
Labels ration packs with 'Departure,' 'Birthday,' and 'Last Meal' to mark special occasions despite isolation.
Frames his handiwork with the rover and waits for others to see his progress.
Uses a screwdriver and rock as makeshift tools to manipulate hardware, showing resourcefulness and problem-solving skills.
Positions and photographs the partially-disassembled rover for engineers to study, indicating careful planning and communication.
Inventories and labels ration packs meticulously, demonstrating organized management of supplies.
Seals the tent to the roof of Rover 2, pressurizes it, and checks for leaks like a hot-air balloon.
Talks directly to camera with humor and self-deprecation calling himself a pirate.
Adapts the Hab with limited resources by stripping parts and repairing the canvas to keep it functional.
Successfully organizes and combines two rovers and Pathfinder into a mobile 'Gypsy caravan' to aid his travel.
Demonstrates knowledge and understanding of international law and territorial claims on Mars to justify his actions.
Plans to commandeer the Ares 4 lander on his own initiative and without explicit permission, showing confidence and boldness.
Becomes gaunt and physically deteriorated, indicating hardship endured though does not explicitly reflect incompetence.
Thanking the Hab for keeping him alive before departure.
Organizing and labeling the experiments carefully.
Reflecting on being the first person on Mars with a sense of wonder.
Organizes experiments carefully before departure, showing planning and attention to detail.
Performs a thorough final shutdown of systems in the Hab, showing technical skill and thoroughness.
Carefully loads remaining rations and equipment into Rover, demonstrating practical preparation and resource management.
Charts course by observing Martian moon Phobos, showing navigation knowledge and situational awareness.
Sits outside rover calmly waiting for solar panels to charge, showing patience and understanding of technical processes.
Sticks to a disciplined daily schedule involving driving, solar panel management, and rest to maintain progress on Mars.
Demonstrates good morale and lightheartedness by asking NASA crew to call him 'Captain Blondebeard', indicating confidence and psychological resilience.
Uses EVA suit for the whole trip instead of life support, indicating resourcefulness and adaptability in using available equipment beyond its intended purpose.
Relies on Martinez to pilot the MAV remotely, showing trust in teamwork but also acceptance of his current limitations in control.

Reacting sarcastically and distraughtly to the risky plan of removing the nose airlock and launching the ship covered with Hab canvas, indicating awareness of the danger and skepticism of the plan's safety.
Mocks the overly optimistic wording of the JPL guys' plan but ultimately embraces it with humor and acceptance.
Tears out acceleration chairs and control panels from the MAV while having fun, showing a playful and resilient attitude toward his precarious situation.
Critically analyzes and questions the plan's risks and physics terminology, demonstrating understanding and skepticism.
Decides to accept the risky plan despite reservations, showing pragmatic confidence.
Tears out acceleration chairs and control panels from the MAV with apparent enjoyment, preparing the craft for launch.
Transforms the MAV extensively, stripping and reconfiguring it to prepare for launch despite exhaustion.
Sits and contemplates his work, openly acknowledging the difficulty and potential failure (his 'Waterloo').
Sits inside the makeshift pressurized tent and calmly prepares to face the situation by eating his last ration pack.
Expresses gratitude and sincerity by telling Lewis 'It's good to hear your voice, Commander,' and 'Thank you for coming back for me' with a breaking voice.
Uses humor and informal language, e.g. 'Tell that asshole no barrel-rolls,' to ease tension and connect with crew.
Maintains composure under extreme stress, readying himself for dangerous re-entry and communicates clearly.
Expresses emotion and vulnerability openly but then regains composure to focus on the task.
Tenses in anticipation before launch, remains conscious and focused under extreme launch conditions despite intense physical forces.
Manages to survive and communicate during a historically unprecedented high-force launch despite the damage to the MAV's structure.
Pulled 12 G's on ascent, showing physical endurance and control under extreme conditions.
Fades unconscious during critical moment, indicating human physical limits under stress.
Holds up middle finger to Mars, shows humor and resilience in a dire situation.
Responds to communications promptly and clearly despite injury.
After regaining consciousness in a damaged vehicle orbiting Mars, he immediately communicates with the Hermes crew to inform them of his status.
Despite physical pain and injury, he maintains presence of mind and composure, responding calmly and clearly over comms.
Engages with Commander Lewis openly, shares detailed technical ideas and shows willingness to collaboratively problem-solve.
Acknowledges and validates Lewis' concerns in a friendly manner before presenting his own idea.
Injects humor ('I would get to fly around like Iron Man') to lighten the mood in a tense situation.
Calculates and proposes using a punctured EVA glove's escaping air as a thruster to maneuver toward Hermes despite risks, showing creative problem-solving under pressure.
Acknowledges counterarguments from Lewis about control difficulties but continues to reason out his idea, demonstrating thoughtful consideration and confidence.
Responds to bad news ('42 meters per second' velocity problem) with realistic acceptance but quickly works toward a new solution instead of panicking.
Calls himself 'Iron Man' humorously when discussing the idea of flying around using atmosphere as thrust, showing confidence and imaginative problem-solving.
Suggests a risky maneuver (using atmosphere as thrust) that others initially find questionable but some consider potentially feasible, demonstrating confidence and readiness to innovate.
Expresses selfishness by wanting the memorials back home to be just his, refusing to let others share the honor.
Shows earnestness and sincerity when pleading with Commander to call off a dangerous plan.
Uses light teasing language ('Smart ass') toward Commander Lewis, indicating friendly tolerance and camaraderie.
Rips free a jagged edge of metal scrap from the console and confidently proposes a risky 'Iron Man plan' to puncture his suit for rescue.
Demonstrates self-awareness and humor about his own mortality and the implications of his rescue efforts.
Responds with humor and confidence upon hearing risky intercept distance, tries to reassure Commander Lewis.
Takes initiative to unclip and eject himself from the MAV to save Commander Lewis, showing trust and willingness to risk himself for others.
Steels himself upon hearing the dangerous intercept range and calmly prepares to eject from the MAV despite the high risk.
Confidently tells Commander Lewis 'I got this' before performing a risky maneuver to save himself.
Successfully ejects from the MAV and maneuvers through space to rendezvous with the Hermes, indicating skill and situational awareness.
Reaches out to Lewis in space and smiles warmly at seeing another human after a long time.
Makes a friendly joke about Lewis’s music taste upon reconnecting.
Successfully executes a daring EVA maneuver to reach and physically connect with astronaut Lewis in space, demonstrating precise control and timing.
Maintains composure and displays humor immediately after a high-stress rescue operation, indicating confidence and mental acuity.
Greets crew warmly and expresses that he missed them despite his hardship.
Jokes about smelling horrible due to not showering for a long time.
Welcomes and engages a room full of astronaut candidates with humor and honesty about his experience.
Admits to fear and vulnerability about nearly dying alone on Mars.
Warns candidates candidly about the harsh realities of space without sugarcoating.
